data.title: Fast and Reliable!
data.body:
I recently purchased the SanDisk 256GB Extreme PRO and I am absolutely blown away by its performance. This memory card is a game-changer for anyone who relies on fast and reliable storage for their photography and videography needs.

One of the standout features of this card is its lightning-fast transfer speeds. With offload speeds of up to 200MB/s, powered by SanDisk QuickFlow Technology, I can save valuable time when transferring my files. Whether I'm shooting 4K UHD video or capturing sequential burst mode photography, this card handles it all with ease.

I also love how seamlessly the SanDisk 256GB Extreme PRO pairs with the SanDisk Professional PRO-READER SD and microSD to achieve maximum speeds. While the reader is sold separately, it's definitely worth the investment for those looking to optimize their workflow.

Furthermore, the shot speeds of up to 140MB/s ensure that I never miss a moment, even during fast-paced shooting situations. And with its UHS Speed Class 3 (U3) and Video Speed Class 30 (V30) ratings, I have peace of mind knowing that this card is designed to support high-quality video recording.

Overall, I can't recommend the SanDisk 256GB Extreme PRO enough. Its unmatched performance, reliability, and compatibility make it a must-have for any professional or enthusiast photographer/videographer. If you're in the market for a top-of-the-line memory card, look no further than the SanDisk Extreme PRO series. It truly deserves a solid 5-star rating!

data.title: Reliable Performance for Your Photography Needs!
data.body:
The SanDisk 64GB Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-I Memory Card has been an absolute game-changer for my photography needs, and it unquestionably deserves a 5-star rating. This memory card has consistently delivered the reliable performance and storage capacity required for my photography endeavors.

First and foremost, the storage capacity of 64GB is ample for capturing a vast number of high-quality photos and videos. It's ideal for extended shooting sessions or when you're traveling and don't want to worry about running out of space.

The speed and performance of this memory card are exceptional. With its Class 10, U3, and V30 ratings, it's well-equipped to handle 4K UHD video recording and high-speed continuous shooting. I've never experienced any lag or slowdown when using this card, even in demanding shooting scenarios.

The durability of the SanDisk Extreme PRO series is a significant advantage. It's built to withstand harsh conditions, including temperature extremes and exposure to X-rays and water. This rugged design provides peace of mind, knowing that your valuable data is protected.

The compatibility of this memory card is another plus. It works seamlessly with a wide range of cameras and devices, making it a versatile choice for photographers of all levels.

The included write-protect switch is a useful feature that prevents accidental data deletion or overwriting. It adds an extra layer of data security, especially when handling critical files.

In summary, the SanDisk 64GB Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-I Memory Card has consistently delivered the reliability, speed, and durability I need for my photography projects. Its ample storage capacity, high-performance ratings, and rugged design make it a top choice for photographers and videographers. I wholeheartedly give it a 5-star rating and confidently recommend it to anyone in need of a dependable and high-capacity memory card for their creative pursuits.

data.title: Unleash Your Creative Potential with the SanDisk 512GB Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-I Memory Card
data.body:
In the realm of photography and videography, storage capacity, speed, and reliability are paramount. The SanDisk 512GB Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-I Memory Card not only meets but exceeds these expectations, making it an indispensable tool for enthusiasts and professionals alike.

Boasting a massive 512GB of storage space, this memory card provides ample room for storing high-resolution photos, 4K videos, and large multimedia files. It's a game-changer for photographers and videographers who require extensive storage without the hassle of frequently swapping out memory cards during critical moments.

The Extreme PRO's UHS-I technology ensures lightning-fast read and write speeds, allowing for seamless and efficient data transfer. Whether you're shooting in burst mode, capturing high-definition video, or transferring files to your computer, the speed of this memory card significantly reduces lag time and enhances overall workflow.

For videographers working with 4K content, the Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-I card is a dream come true. Its sustained write speeds can keep up with the demands of high-bitrate 4K video recording, ensuring smooth and uninterrupted capture of cinematic moments. This makes it an ideal choice for content creators who demand uncompromising performance.

The rugged design of the Extreme PRO ensures durability in challenging conditions. It is temperature-proof, waterproof, shockproof, and X-ray proof, providing peace of mind for photographers and videographers working in diverse environments. Whether you're shooting in extreme heat, amidst water splashes, or in rugged outdoor settings, this memory card can withstand the elements.

The SanDisk 512GB Extreme PRO is compatible with a wide range of devices, including digital cameras, camcorders, and laptops with SD card slots. Its versatility makes it a go-to choice for professionals who use multiple devices in their workflow, streamlining the process of data transfer and storage.

The SanDisk 512GB Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-I Memory Card is a powerhouse solution for photographers and videographers seeking uncompromising performance, generous storage, and robust durability. Its fast read and write speeds, coupled with an impressive capacity, make it an ideal choice for professionals working with high-resolution media. Whether you're a wildlife photographer, a wedding videographer, or a content creator pushing the boundaries of visual storytelling, this memory card is a reliable and efficient companion that allows you to focus on capturing the perfect shot without worrying about storage limitations.

data.title: SanDisk 256GB Extreme PRO SDXC - Unleash the Power of Speed and Storage
data.body:
I recently upgraded to the SanDisk 256GB Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-I Memory Card, and it's been nothing short of impressive. This memory card is a powerhouse, delivering the perfect blend of speed and massive storage capacity.

Pros:

Blazing Fast Speeds: The UHS-I technology ensures lightning-fast read and write speeds, making it ideal for high-performance tasks like 4K video recording and burst mode photography.

Massive Storage Capacity: With 256GB, I now have ample space for my extensive photo and video library. No more worrying about running out of storage during crucial moments.

Durable Design: The rugged construction gives me confidence in its durability. It's built to withstand harsh conditions, making it a reliable companion for adventures and professional shoots.

Compatibility: The card works seamlessly with a variety of devices, from cameras to laptops. The versatility is a major plus.

data.title: Works Great!
data.body:
my camera, and I couldn't be more impressed with its performance. This memory card truly lives up to the SanDisk reputation for quality and reliability.

The write and read speeds of this card are outstanding, allowing me to capture high-resolution photos and 4K videos with ease. The quick transfer speeds also make it a breeze to offload my media onto my computer for editing. I've noticed a significant improvement in the overall responsiveness of my camera, thanks to the UHS-I technology.

What truly sets this memory card apart is its robust build quality. The durable construction gives me confidence that my valuable data is well-protected, especially when I'm shooting in challenging conditions. The weather-resistant design has been a lifesaver during outdoor shoots, providing peace of mind that my data is safe even in unpredictable environments.

The ample storage capacity of 64GB is perfect for extended shooting sessions without constantly worrying about running out of space. Whether you're a professional photographer or an amateur enthusiast, this card offers the ideal balance between capacity and performance.

In summary, the SanDisk 64GB Extreme PRO SDXC UHS-I Memory Card has exceeded my expectations. Its exceptional speed, reliability, and durability make it a must-have for anyone serious about photography or videography. I wholeheartedly recommend this memory card to fellow enthusiasts who demand nothing but the best for their creative endeavors. It's a five-star product that delivers on every front!

data.title: Good cards, just keep in mind warranty replacements can be a chore
data.body:
This review is for the 256 GB card.

As sizes have increased and prices have declined, I have increased the size of my memory cards on my phones and tablets, previously using a 64GB and 128GB cards. With that being said, the brand I go with is Sandisk and when this went on sale for less than 30 bucks, I grabbed it. They have been reliable and most importantly have good lifetime warranties, although I will put that with a caveat that they can be a bit of a pain to deal with on getting replacements sent. I get the extreme pros because of the lifetime warranty as San disk has moved away from warrantying all of the SSD’s for life.

For this particular card, I am using as an SSD for my old venerable I-pod, mainly for storing my 88 gigs of music files. This installed into my SSD card reader for my I-pod with no issues and recognized the full size without a hitch.

The card’s transfer rate is fast. I copied the music files quickly with no issues. I can access the files quickly and easily and the card has worked reliably as I expect from Sandisk. Keep in mind that I got mine direct from AMZ. I suggest either that or a known reliable seller, which can make a difference in getting a real one versus not. If you get one that has different fonts or just looks different, I suggest checking with San disk directly to make sure you got what you expected.

The only reason the rating for these are not 5 stars is because San disk has started lowering their warranties on their products and making it a bit more difficult to get warranty replacements.

4 stars

data.title: Works in DLSR, didn't fit in camcorder for some reason
data.body: This 64GB card fit fine in my Nikon D5100. But for some reason it did not "click" into place when I tried to put it in my Sony HDR_PJ260 camcorder. It would slide in and then just spring back out, no matter how far I pushed it in. Other 64GB SDXC cards worked fine in my camcorder, and this one worked fine in my DSLR, so I don't know what it was about the combination that made it not work for me.

data.title: Some of The Best Prices on The Web for These - Sandisk are my favorite brand
data.body:
I routinely buy these as my cameras increase in file sizes. I buy all of my Sandisk cards directly from Amazon and have never had an issue with fakes (Make sure they are sold and shipped by Amazon).

Excellent cards, built well. Prices are fantastic honestly. Definitely feel free to shop around. You'll find these cards on Amazon always being super competitive and most often the affordable option.

Sandisk is considered the premium brand for SD cards, so you can purchase with confidence.

data.title: Super-fast with massive storage!!!
data.body: This 256GB Extreme Pro is just awesome! I have the 128GB Extreme Pro with a slower read/write rate and even that performs exceptionally well. These cards are built for quality performance and longevity. I highly recommend purchasing one to make your workflow easier.

data.title: Exactly what it's supposed to be
data.body: I record dance performances for my children's dance studio. We had 45 routines entered in a recent competition, and they ALL fit on this one card. I am always worried that I'll run out of memory or power. I solved the power issue with a plug-in "battery" for the camera, and now the memory issue has been solved by this card. I still carry two of them just in case one fails for one reason or another, but so far this has worked perfectly. FYI- in HD, with standard settings on a Canon EOS Rebel t5, one 2 1/2-minute routine requires about 1GB of memory. I could have gone with less, but this way I have plenty of storage for capturing photos as well.

data.title: Perfect
data.body:
I got this to record audio from a Tascam model 24 mixer, and found that 256G is more than enough for my needs. I've never come close to filling it. It's a fast card, so pulling the tracks off of it onto the computer is super quick.

I always go for Sandisk for SD cards. I've never had one go bad.

data.title: Good for Price
data.body: I use this with my canon r7 and rf 100-400 and it work perfectly. I can take about 40 pics at 1/1600 shutter speed and it writes the photo to the card in about 5-10 seconds. I've also done a few videos but haven't really done enough to comment on it.

data.title: Great Storage For My Canon
data.body: I love to take pictures, and I do not like to worry about how much storage space I have left on my DSLR. SanDisk has been reliable for a long time, and hey remain reliable! I'm able to store high quality versions of the photos I take, and then easily transfer the data straight to my laptop or phone. ( The 2-year warranty is a great plus for buying SanDisk quality, as well! )

data.title: Works as it's supposed to
data.body: I haven't tracked the transfer speeds which felt fast enough and experienced no issue so far in my workflow when copying/pasting or moving files from SD card to my PC or Macbook.

data.title: Great SD Card
data.body: I used this originally as my only SD card to hold all of my RAW and JPEG's before I got a second card for my RAW photos. It worked fine for that and I still use it every time I shoot for my JPEG backups.

data.title: Great memory card for dslr!
data.body: Used it on a canon worked like a charm, exported my 4k footage just fine. Gonna test it on a sony next but i’m sure it’ll hold up just fine.

data.title: SanDisk 64GB Extreme Pro
data.body: I bought a new printer that didn't use thumb drives so I needed a SanDisk. So far I like it. Easy to use and works well.

data.title: Lots of storage
data.body: Love these and have never had one fail! Great for high res photos or 4K video.

data.title: Great value, good speeds
data.body: Here are my speed test results for the 64GB version. I thought others might find it useful.

data.title: Great memory card for the price
data.body: Video recordings by son who has hd camera for first time
